data.description: Alaskaâ€™s parks, forests, and refuges are rich and varied. The Alaska Public Lands Information Centers help visitors and residents to have meaningful, safe, enjoyable experiences on public lands, and encourages them to sustain the natural and cultural resources of Alaska. These centers provide trip-planning, interpretation, and education for all ages.

entranceFees.description: No entry fee to visit the visitors center
entranceFees.title: Free Admittance

data.directionsInfo: Anchorage APLIC is located in downtown Anchorage on 4th Avenue, in the Federal Building. Fairbanks APLIC is located in downtown Fairbanks on the corner of Dunkel Street and Wendell Avenue, near the Chena River.

operatingHours.description:
Summer Hours: 9-5, Every Day, Late May to Mid September, Open Federal Holidays
Winter Hours: 10-5, Mon-Thur, closed for lunch 12-1, September to Early May, Closed Federal Holidays
operatingHours.name: Anchorage Hours

operatingHours.description:
Summer Hours: 8-6, Every Day, Memorial Day through Labor Day, Open Federal Holidays
Winter Hours: 8-5, Mon-Sat, Labor Day through Memorial Day, Closed Federal Holidays

101 Dunkel Street Suite 110
Fairbanks, AK 99701

Telephone: 907.459.3730
Fax: 907.459.3729
Email: fair_interpretation@nps.gov
operatingHours.name: Fairbanks Hours

images.altText: Two Hikers stand on top of a very large granite boulder, looking out across the landscape
images.caption: Hikers on top of Angel Rocks near Fairbanks look out across the landscape of Chena River State Recreation Area

data.weatherInfo: Visitors center is located inside the Federal Building and weather conditions are seasonal conditions of the Anchorage area, outside the facility.
data.name: Alaska Public Lands
